turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to schedule an appointment with Dr. Ramirez.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I can help you with that. Are you an existing patient?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, I am. My name is John Smith.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright, Mr. Smith. And what is the reason for your visit today?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's for my annual check-up and I've been feeling a bit more tired than usual lately.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I see. Let me check Dr. Ramirez's availability. One moment please... Okay, she has an opening on Tuesday the 15th at 10:00 AM or Thursday the 17th at 2:30 PM. Does either of those work for you?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, those are both terrible. Is there anything else, maybe later in the month? I really can't miss work.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Let me see... Dr. Ramirez has availability on the 29th at 11:00 AM. Will that work?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, the 29th at 11:00 AM is perfect. Quick question - Does Dr. Ramirez usually run on time? Last time I waited over an hour!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: While we always strive to keep appointments on schedule, unexpected delays can sometimes occur. We appreciate your patience. I have scheduled you for November 29th at 11:00 AM. You will receive a confirmation email shortly. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
